skill.name: rdkit
skill.description: Cheminformatics toolkit for fine-grained molecular control. SMILES/SDF parsing, descriptors (MW, LogP, TPSA), fingerprints, substructure search, 2D/3D generation, similarity, reactions. For standard workflows with simpler interface, use datamol (wrapper around RDKit). Use rdkit for advanced control, custom sanitization, specialized algorithms.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns were found. The scripts perform local file I/O and RDKit computations only.

content.value_statement: You need reliable molecular analysis and filtering for small molecule datasets. This skill provides RDKit guidance and scripts for similarity search, descriptors, and substructure filters.
actual_capabilities: Run fingerprint-based similarity search with Morgan, RDKit, MACCS, atom pair, or torsion methods.
Compute molecular properties and drug-likeness metrics from SMILES or SDF/SMI files.
Filter molecules by SMARTS patterns with include and exclude modes.
Export similarity hits and property tables to CSV.
Write filtered molecules to SDF or SMILES formats.
limitations: Requires RDKit installed in the Python environment.
Input and output files are limited to SDF, MOL, SMI, SMILES, or TXT.
Similarity search is fingerprint based and does not perform 3D alignment.
No built-in database indexing or distributed processing.

use_cases.title: Screen analogs by similarity
use_cases.description: Find close analogs of a query SMILES in an SDF or SMILES database using fingerprint similarity.

use_cases.title: Quick property profiling
use_cases.description: Generate key descriptors and Lipinski checks for a list of candidate molecules.

use_cases.title: Remove unwanted substructures
use_cases.description: Exclude PAINS or reactive groups from a library using SMARTS filters.

prompt_templates.title: Compute basic properties
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate RDKit molecular properties for SMILES CCO and summarize MW, LogP, TPSA, HBD, HBA, and Lipinski pass.

prompt_templates.title: Batch properties to CSV
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the molecular properties script on molecules.smi and write results to properties.csv. Note any failed parses.

prompt_templates.title: Similarity search hits
prompt_templates.prompt: Run similarity search for query CCO against database.smi using Morgan radius 3, threshold 0.8, and output hits.csv.

prompt_templates.title: PAINS exclusion filter
prompt_templates.prompt: Filter compounds.smi to exclude the PAINS library, write clean.smi, and produce a CSV report of excluded matches.

output_examples.input: Calculate properties for SMILES CCO and summarize key results.

best_practices: Validate SMILES parsing and skip molecules that return None.
Choose fingerprint type and threshold based on the screening goal.
Save CSV outputs for traceability and downstream analysis.
anti_patterns: Running similarity search with an invalid or empty query molecule.
Using unsupported file formats without conversion.

faq.question: Which environments are supported?
faq.answer: Any Python environment with RDKit installed, typically via conda or rdkit-pypi.

faq.question: What are the size limits?
faq.answer: No hard limits are coded, but large libraries may be slow without indexing.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. The scripts accept file inputs and write CSV or SDF outputs for chaining.

faq.question: Does it access my sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. The code performs local file I/O only and makes no network calls.

faq.question: What if RDKit is not installed?
faq.answer: Install RDKit with conda or pip, then rerun the script.

faq.question: How does this compare to datamol?
faq.answer: This skill uses direct RDKit APIs for advanced control, while datamol provides simpler wrappers.
